title: British Airways celebrates India's independence sayTravelandtourworld.com
text:
British Airways celebrates India’s independence say Published on : Wednesday, August 12, 2015
British Airways is inviting its customers from India to celebrate Independence Day, with a special offer on flights from India to the UK and selected destinations in Europe.
British Airways is delighted to offer 15% discount on its World Traveller economy class, World Traveller Plus premium economy and the award-winning Club World business class to commemorate India’s 69th Independence Day. The offer is available for outbound travel from India between September 1, 2015 and December 31, 2016, and must be booked by August 16, 2015. The airline is also pleased to offer incredible prices for combined booking of flights and hotels to add extra value to its customers’ holiday and travel experience. Please visit ba.com for further information and bookings.
Moran Birger, British Airways’ regional commercial manager, South Asia, said, “Customers from India can rediscover London with exciting events this autumn and winter, be it the city-wide celebration of great food at the London Restaurant Festival from 1-31 October, or by soaking up the festival atmosphere at Hyde Park’s Winter Wonderland. Those looking to get into the festive spirit can try traditional Glühwein at Germany’s oldest Christmas market in Dresden. Meanwhile, families looking for a holiday destination can take a trip to Reykjavik in Iceland to see the Northern Lights, a truly magical natural phenomenon.”
What’s more, customers from Delhi will become the first at British Airways globally to experience the state-of-the-art brand new Boeing 787-9 and the new First cabin from 25 October 2015.”
Last year marked British Airways’ 90 years of service to India showcasing our commitment to the market and we are excited to be celebrating India’s 69th Independence Day with our customers. We encourag­e customers to take advantage of our great value fares and explore the wonderful sites that the UK and Europe have to offer,” Birger added.Customers can experience British Airways’ exceptional quality and impeccable service in its’ World Traveller, World Traveller Plus and Club World cabins.
World Traveller is a full-service economy class cabin that offer excellent value with all the comfort and benefits one can expect from British Airways. World Traveller Plus premium economy is a great option for cost-conscious business travellers and discerning leisure passengers looking for greater comfort, space and privacy.
British Airways’ award-winning Club World cabin combines elements from the home and business to create an ideal environment that is comfortable, flexible and private. British Airways currently operates 49 flights a week from five key cities in India – New Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Bangalore and Hyderabad. Customers can book their whole journey on ba.com, earn frequent flyer points, gain access to airport lounges and enjoy world-class customer services.
Source:- British Airways
